intro: Orthosiphon inconcinnus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurry, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in late summer. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Orthosiphon inconcinnus is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
